meanings.definition: A rasping tongue structure found in mollusks.
meanings.sent1: The radulae of the snail helps it scrape off food from surfaces.
meanings.sent2: Mollusks use their radulae to feed on algae and small organisms.
meanings.sent3: The radulae of the clam threw a tiny party to celebrate its successful meal.
meanings.sent4: The radulae of the oyster worked tirelessly, like a tiny rake in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The radulae, like a tiny conveyor belt, moved food into the mollusk's mouth.

meanings.definition: Plural form of radula, referring to multiple rasping tongue structures in mollusks.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the radulae of different mollusk species to understand their feeding habits.
meanings.sent2: The radulae of the snails in the aquarium were fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The radulae of the mussels formed a choir and sang underwater melodies.
meanings.sent4: The radulae of the octopus danced gracefully, like synchronized swimmers in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The radulae, like tiny brushes, cleaned the mollusks' feeding area efficiently.
